snippet: A settlement in a shareholder lawsuit was sent back by a federal judge, in part because it could be mostly consumed by lawyers’ fees.
abstract: Federal Judge P Kevin Castel orders two pension funds in Louisiana and Florida to seek larger settlement with Bank of America over its 2008 acquisition of Merrill Lynch; current deal for $20 million is dwarfed by more recent $2.4 billion settlement in separate lawsuit over same issue.
lead_paragraph: A settlement in a shareholder lawsuit was sent back by a federal judge, in part because it could be mostly consumed by lawyers’ fees.

headline.seo: Judge Sends Back $20 Million Settlement to Bank of America Suit
headline.main: Judge Calls for Revision of $20 Million Payout in Bank of America Suit
headline.print_headline: Judge Calls for Revision Of $20 Million Payout In Bank of America Suit
